Articles.Content:
Hello people, my name is NASASpace101 (Not really) and I'm an expert rocket scientist! (He's a good liar isn't he?)

Anyway i'm a very long time forum dweller and just recently registered, please inform me if I do something wrong or something that you find offensive. I really love KSP because it combines my two favorite things, planes and rockets. I like doing historical recreations in RSS, or maybe I do kerbalized versions in stock KSP. 

Anyway I got KSP after watching Scott Manley's wonderful videos (I like saying anyways don't I?) and also after watching Chris P Bacon's RSS recreations. I understand alot of you people are very intelligent, far more than me, and far more superior in creating stuff in KSP ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif).

Anyway please tell me if I seem rude, or such. I do get misunderstood alot. I'm pretty sure lots of you understand because this forum is way more understanding than some others...

Okay, thanks for reading peoples!

Very humble introduction there, but welcome nonetheless. Let's see... some cookies over here, plenty of beverages lining the fridge, we got pizza on the way, it's gonna be a good time. And you certainly had me fooled with the first line.

> 
> Very humble introduction there, but welcome nonetheless. Let's see... some cookies over here, plenty of beverages lining the fridge, we got pizza on the way, it's gonna be a good time. And you certainly had me fooled with the first line.

Dangit, no rocket fuel to drink? 

I've already had enough...

Anyway thanks for the welcome!

Hello NasaSpace101 and welcome to the forums!

It's always nice to see a lurker come in from the cold.

An easy way to avoid accidental rudeness and decrease the chances of being misunderstood is to take a look at the [Forum Rules](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/30065-Forum-Rules), [the FAQ](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/48073-Forum-FAQ-%E2%80%93-Answers-for-New-Users), and the [Good Conduct Guide](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/13142-The-Good-Conduct-Guide).

If you need any help with gameplay, be sure to visit the [Gameplay Questions and Tutorials](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/15-Gameplay-Questions-and-Tutorials) section, as well as [the Wiki](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Main_Page).

Happy landings!

Welcome!

We have snacks, though, if you want.

Also: 19 posts!!? Already!?!?

> 
> Dangit, no rocket fuel to drink? 
> I've already had enough...
> 
> Anyway thanks for the welcome!

Anytime. But, though we don't have kerosene rocket fuel, I do have a bit of liquid hydrogen in the back. It's gourmet; only Nuclears drink it. If you're up to it, I can go getcha a glass. Well, more like a canister.

> 
> Welcome!
> We have snacks, though, if you want.
> 
> Also: 19 posts!!? Already!?!?

Yeah, i've been sneaking around on the Tantares thread.

> 
> Hello NasaSpace101 and welcome to the forums!
> It's always nice to see a lurker come in from the cold.
> 
> An easy way to avoid accidental rudeness and decrease the chances of being misunderstood is to take a look at the [Forum Rules](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/30065-Forum-Rules), [the FAQ](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/48073-Forum-FAQ-%E2%80%93-Answers-for-New-Users), and the [Good Conduct Guide](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/13142-The-Good-Conduct-Guide).
> 
> If you need any help with gameplay, be sure to visit the [Gameplay Questions and Tutorials](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/15-Gameplay-Questions-and-Tutorials) section, as well as [the Wiki](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Main_Page).
> 
> Happy landings!

Yep, I'm sure i'm going to have *many* ***Happy*** *landings.*

Thanks for the nice comments guys ![:kiss:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_kiss.gif)

> 
> Anytime. But, though we don't have kerosene rocket fuel, I do have a bit of liquid hydrogen in the back. It's gourmet; only Nuclears drink it. If you're up to it, I can go getcha a glass. Well, more like a canister.

I'm up to it, I've gone that far many times. Not when it comes to flying though,
I have a feeling you are going to have a great time over here. Hope to see you around!
